title: Danny Dyer says he'll take over from Ant and Dec as most popular presenter
text:
Danny Dyer has warned Ant and Dec that there’s a ‘new geezer in town’ (Picture: REX/Getty)

Ant McPartlin and Declan Donnelly has have a strong hold on prime time TV slot for years, but now the pair might face some stiff competition from none other than Danny Dyer.

The EastEnders star is hosting new BBC game show The Wall tonight and the actor has joked that the award-winning duo should be worried.

The One Show host Patrick Kielty said to the star: ‘We love that you’re bringing a bit of danger to Saturday night. I think Ant and Dec are going to be worried.’

‘I think they’ve had a good run, but there’s a new geezer in town’, Danny replied.

The Wall has been described as ‘the ultimate combination of strategy, knowledge and luck’ and viewers have been promised ‘colossal wins and heart-breaking losses’ on the six-part show.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The pairs are required to have the right answers, the right bounces and trust in each other to win a life-changing cash prize.

Danny is dipping his toe into game show hosting with BBC’s The Wall (Picture: Getty Images)

The Football Factory star previously admitted he wasn’t sure about the BBC show at first, or if he was the right person for it.

‘I thought they were on drugs! Really, you want me to do a game show, filmed in Poland? I was very confused by it all, to be honest,’ he explained. ‘But I watched the American version and I thought you know what, let’s have a go…’

He joked that Ant and Dec might lose their crown to him (Picture: ITV)

Speaking previously about the show, Danny said: ‘I’d never had a desire to host a game show before I saw this game.

‘I couldn’t turn down the opportunity to help win the public some serious life-changing readies. I love it.’

The actor has famously been working closely with the Beeb ever since he joined EastEnders back in 2013.

The Wall launches tonight at 8.35pm on on BBC One.

description: EastEnders star Danny Dyer is hosting new BBC game show The Wall tonight and the actor has joked that Ant and Dec should be worried.
